subject: Re: [junit] Re: JunitPerf ThreadedTest
msgSnippet: Here s an example of how to create multiple load tests, one for each test case method, and then measure the maximum elapsed time as the total time for all the
messageBody:
Here's an example of how to create multiple load tests, one for each
test case method, and then measure the maximum elapsed time as the
total time for all the load tests to complete. You can specify
different max users, iterations, and timer delays for each load test.
Calculating an average time isn't supported (yet).

public static Test suite() {

Timer timer = new ConstantTimer(0);
int maxUsers = 2;
int iterations = 10;
long maxElapsedTime = 60000;

Test testCaseA = new ExampleTestCase("testA");
Test testCaseB = new ExampleTestCase("testB");
Test testCaseC = new ExampleTestCase("testC");

Test loadTest1 =
new LoadTest(testCaseA, maxUsers, iterations, timer);
Test loadTest2 =
new LoadTest(testCaseB, maxUsers, iterations, timer);
Test loadTest3 =
new LoadTest(testCaseC, maxUsers, iterations, timer);

TestSuite loadSuite = new TestSuite();
loadSuite.addTest(loadTest1);
loadSuite.addTest(loadTest2);
loadSuite.addTest(loadTest3);

Test timedTest = new TimedTest(loadSuite, maxElapsedTime);

TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
suite.addTest(timedTest);

return suite;
}

This should get you started. If you have more questions, we should
probably take this discussion off-line.

Mike


--- knvms@... wrote:
> Hi Mike
> First thanx for mail.
> Exactly I've used the way u suggested with different load conditions
> for each test before trying explicity with ThreadedTest.
>
> Please observe the scenario:
>
> I've have a single test case with three tests: TransTx1(create and
> test a XXBean),TransTx2(Create and test a YYBean),TransTx2(Create and
>
> Remove XXBean).Conditions for tests are : Concurrent users for
> Tx1 :20 Tx2:20 and Tx3: 10; Load Profile should be sleeping for 10
> secs and over 15 minutes. My measurement should be Total Quantity of
> each transaction type, avg xact time of each transaction type.
> Could u help me to implement this?
>
> Advance thanx.
> Madhu
>
> --- In junit@y..., Mike Clark <mike@c...> wrote:
> > When you construct a LoadTest, a ThreadedTest and its associated
> > ThreadBarrier are used by default, so there's no need to decorate
> the
> > LoadTest instance as a ThreadedTest. Here's an example suite()
> method
> > that adds two LoadTest instances to the suite, each with different
> load
> > testing parameters:
> >
> > public static Test suite() {
> > TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
> >
> > Timer timer = new ConstantTimer(0);
> >
> > int maxUsers = 1;
> > int iterations = 50;
> > long maxElapsedTime = 60000;
> >
> > Test testCase1 = new ExampleTestCase("testFoo");
> > Test loadTest1 = new LoadTest(testCase1, maxUsers,
> iterations,
> > timer);
> > Test timedTest1 = new TimedTest(loadTest1, maxElapsedTime);
> >
> > maxUsers = 10;
> > iterations = 100;
> > maxElapsedTime = 120000;
> >
> > Test testCase2 = new ExampleTestCase("testBar");
> > Test loadTest2 = new LoadTest(testCase2, maxUsers,
> iterations,
> > timer);
> > Test timedTest2 = new TimedTest(loadTest2, maxElapsedTime);
> >
> > suite.addTest(timedTest1);
> > suite.addTest(timedTest2);
> >
> > return suite;
> > }
> >
> > Mike
> >
> > --- knvms@h... wrote:
